Can We Do the Job?; AMERICANS ARE ALONE IN THE WORLD. By Luigi Barzini Jr. 209 pp. New York: Random House. $2.50.

WHEN Tocqueville wrote, over a century ago, his purpose was to describe in America the workings of a democracy whose progress was, he argued, irresistible. Here, he said, were the advantages of democracy, here the disadvantages; let the Old World be warned. View Full Article in Timesmachine Â»
